name: analysis
content:

Add to word list
B2 [ C or U ] the act of studying or examining something in detail, in order to discover or understand more about it, or your opinion and judgment after doing this: Our financial experts conducted an independent analysis of the investment plan's performance. I was interested in Clare's analysis of the situation. Some of these arguments need further analysis.
[ C or U ] the act of examining a substance, especially by separating it into its parts, in order to discover what it is or contains: Chemical analysis revealed a high content of copper. The forensic lab carried out a second analysis of the DNA sample.
[ U ] a process or treatment in which a person's unconscious mind is examined according to a theory of the human personality, to discover the hidden causes of their emotional or mental problems: He travelled to Switzerland to undergo analysis with Jung. The poet had spent years in analysis. Synonym
psychoanalysis
More examplesFewer examplesSophisticated statistical analysis was employed to obtain these results.I read two interesting historical analyses of the period.This book is designed to be provocative rather than a watertight piece of economic analysis.The documentary's analysis of the issues was very superficial.A pattern is beginning to emerge from our analysis of the accident data.They took blood and urine specimens for analysis.
